titleproper.value:
Guide to the Palladium Flyers Collection
                    <num>MSS 441</num>

author.value: Finding aid prepared by Laurainne Ojo-Ohikuare, 2015.

creation.value:
This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit
                <date>2015-09-02T10:25-0400</date>

abstract.label: Abstract
abstract.value: From its opening in 1985 through the late 1980s, New York City's Palladium was one of the major features in the New York club scene, providing a venue for many different events. The Palladium Flyers Collection consists of flyers and posters for photographic, art, and fashion exhibitions and receptions as well as book publication releases, live performances, and parties. The scope of this collection gives insight to the distinct position of The Palladium nightclub and its involvement in the Downtown New York scene.

p.value: Open to researchers. Appointments are necessary for the use of manuscript and archival collections.

Published citations should take the following form:
                <lb/>
                <lb/> Identification of item, date (if known); Palladium Flyers Collection; MSS 441; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
The collection was purchased by NYU's Fales Library & Special Collections from a bookseller in 2015.
After closing in 1997, New York University converted this landmark into a residence hall and athletic facility for undergraduate students.
Series VII: Parties contains flyers and/or posters to birthday celebrations, anniversaries, and themed events.
